Description: Lower body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: painted decoration consisting of naked athlete (lower body and trace of hand remaining) to right; glazed below with broad reserved band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The suffix "3" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other am1371 sherds. The number 223 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. There is no evidence of black figure-related incision on the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1383) (phase 3)
